what: Apply IOM theme to a ggplot object — apply_theme
title: Apply IOM theme to a ggplot object — apply_theme
text: Adds thematic presets adhering IOM visual branding ggplot object. function adjusts text sizes, colors, legend positioning, panel grids, visual elements based specified plot type.

title: Apply IOM theme to a ggplot object — apply_theme
code: apply_theme(type, basesize = 7, font = "Open Sans", facets = FALSE)

title: Apply IOM theme to a ggplot object — apply_theme
text: type Character. Type plot theme. One "line", "bar-horizontal", "bar-vertical", "scatter", "map", "void". basesize Numeric. Base font size points. Default 7. font Character. Font family text elements. Default "Gill Sans Nova". facets Logical. Whether plot faceted. Default FALSE.

title: Apply IOM theme to a ggplot object — apply_theme
text: list ggplot2 theme elements added ggplot object.

title: Apply IOM theme to a ggplot object — apply_theme
text: basesize parameter controls base font size axis labels, titles, plot annotations. font parameter sets font family. facets parameter specifies whether plot uses faceting, adjusts strip appearance accordingly. Supported plot types: "line" - Line plots appropriate legend keys grid lines. "bar-horizontal" - Horizontal bar plots grid x-axis. "bar-vertical" - Vertical bar plots grid y-axis. "scatter" - Scatter plots grid lines. "map" - Map plots minimal axis text grid. "void" - Empty theme (implemented , can added).

title: Apply IOM theme to a ggplot object — apply_theme
code: library(ggplot2) #> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.4.3  # Simple scatter plot with IOM theme p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Scatter Plot with IOM Theme",     caption = "Source: mpg dataset"   ) +   apply_theme(type = "scatter", basesize = 9)  p

what: Retrieve Data for Plotting by Key and Country ISO Code — digest_data
title: Retrieve Data for Plotting by Key and Country ISO Code — digest_data
text: function dynamically calls getter function amerdigest package based provided key. Optionally, filters data ISO3 country code.

title: Retrieve Data for Plotting by Key and Country ISO Code — digest_data
Retrieve Data for Plotting by Key and Country ISO Code — digest_data
text: key Character. data key specify getter function call. Must correspond function named get_<key> inside amerdigest package. iso Character NULL. Optional ISO3 country code filter data country. provided, must exist countrynames$iso3. ... Additional arguments passed underlying getter function.

title: Retrieve Data for Plotting by Key and Country ISO Code — digest_data
text: list (object) returned called getter function.

title: Generate a Preset Plot or Retrieve Plot Metadata — digest_plot
Generate a Preset Plot or Retrieve Plot Metadata — digest_plot
text: key Character. plot key identifying plot generate. Must correspond function named plot_<key> amerdigest package. iso Character NULL. ISO3 country code generate plot. NULL, function returns plot metadata instead plot. ... Additional arguments passed plot generating function.

title: Generate a Preset Plot or Retrieve Plot Metadata — digest_plot
text: ggplot object iso provided, list containing plot metadata iso NULL.

code: prettylabel(   N,   signif = 2,   shorten = TRUE,   spell = FALSE,   padzero = FALSE,   pct = FALSE,   currency = NULL )

title: Pretty Number Formatting — prettylabel
text: N number numeric vector formatted. signif Number significant digits retain. Must > 0. Default 2. shorten Logical. TRUE, abbreviates long numbers (e.g., 1,200 → "1.2K"). Currently used directly preserved backward compatibility. spell Logical. TRUE, spells large values (e.g., "million" instead "M"). padzero Logical. TRUE, pads decimals reach requested precision. pct Logical. TRUE, appends percent sign " per cent" spell = TRUE. currency Optional string (e.g., "$", "€") prepend currency symbol.

title: Pretty Number Formatting — prettylabel
text: character vector formatted number labels.

title: Pretty Number Formatting — prettylabel
code: prettylabel(123456)                      # "123K" #> [1] "123K"  prettylabel(123456789, spell = TRUE)     # "123 million" #> [1] "123 million"  prettylabel(0.756, pct = TRUE)           # "75.6%" #> [1] "0.76%"  prettylabel(1200, currency = "$")        # "$1.2K" #> [1] "$1.2K"  prettylabel(c(1e6, 2e9), signif = 3)     # "1.00M" "2.00B" #> [1] "1M" "2B"  prettylabel(NA)                          # NA #> [1] NA

what: Create a Quarto file based on defined template and for a specific country — render_digest
title: Create a Quarto file based on defined template and for a specific country — render_digest
text: function creates Quarto file based defined template copying necessary template files _extensions directory generating new Quarto Markdown (.qmd) file.

title: Create a Quarto file based on defined template and for a specific country — render_digest
Create a Quarto file based on defined template and for a specific country — render_digest
text: file_name character string specifying name new Quarto Markdown file. NULL, function use "index" default file name. country_iso country iso number report generate

title: Create a Quarto file based on defined template and for a specific country — render_digest
text: function return value. performs file operations set Quarto IOM story template current working directory.

title: Create a Quarto file based on defined template and for a specific country — render_digest
text: function performs following steps: Checks file_name provided. , index per default. Verifies ext_name selected. Creates _extensions directory exist. Creates subdirectory within _extensions specified extension. Copies extension files package's internal extdata directory _extensions. Checks extension files successfully copied. Creates new Quarto Markdown file based template. Opens new file editor.

title: Create a Quarto file based on defined template and for a specific country — render_digest

what: Set Y-Axis Formatting for Chart Plots — set_axis
title: Set Y-Axis Formatting for Chart Plots — set_axis
text: Dynamically determines appropriate Y-axis breaks, labels, title based maximum value vector numeric data. Used standardize axis formatting across plots.

title: Set Y-Axis Formatting for Chart Plots — set_axis
Set Y-Axis Formatting for Chart Plots — set_axis
text: values numeric vector. Typically, column values plotted. units character string describing units measurement (e.g., "Persons", "USD").

title: Set Y-Axis Formatting for Chart Plots — set_axis
text: list components: breaks — Either numeric vector waiver(). labels — labeling function character vector. title — character string axis title.

title: Set Y-Axis Formatting for Chart Plots — set_axis
code: set_axis(c(100, 500, 1000), units = "Persons") #> $breaks #> list() #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "waiver" #>  #> $labels #> list() #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "waiver" #>  #> $title #> [1] "Persons" #>  set_axis(c(5e8, 1.5e9), units = "USD") #> $breaks #> [1] 0.0e+00 5.0e+08 1.0e+09 1.5e+09 #>  #> $labels #> [1] "0"   "0.5" "1.0" "1.5" #>  #> $title #> [1] "Billions USD" #>

what: Update matching font defaults for text geoms — update_geom_font_defaults
title: Update matching font defaults for text geoms — update_geom_font_defaults
text: Updates ggplot2::geom_label ggplot2::geom_text font defaults

title: Update matching font defaults for text geoms — update_geom_font_defaults
code: update_geom_font_defaults(   family = if (package_font_installed()) "Gill Sans Nova" else "sans",   face = "plain",   size = 3.5,   color = "#1a1a1a" )

title: Update matching font defaults for text geoms — update_geom_font_defaults
text: family Font family, default "Lato". face Font face, default "plain". size font size mm. color Font color, default "#1a1a1a".

title: Update matching font defaults for text geoms — update_geom_font_defaults
